info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 18 at 12:59PM MST until December 19 at 3:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST SUNDAY FOR ELEVATIONS BELOW 4500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST SUNDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory for elevations below 4500 feet, snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches. For the Winter Storm Warning for elevations above 4500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches, with 6 to 12 inches over Marias Pass and locally higher in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 85 mph. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until 3 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
